intro: Adenostemma lanceolatum, commonly known as the narrow-leaf milkweed, is a flowering plant native to Africa and parts of Asia. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes other plants such as hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its slender, lance-shaped leaves and produces clusters of small, pinkish-white flowers. It typically grows in sandy or rocky soils and is often found in arid or semi-arid regions. Adenostemma lanceolatum is known for its ability to thrive in harsh environments, making it a hardy and adaptable species.
